Recommended as a story-driven shooter like Wolfenstein: The New Order, which I also enjoyed very much. The comparisons to Fallout 3 or 4 are inaccurate. This is not open world, it's on rails. On hardest difficulty the challenge is real and conserving ammo and locating caches becomes important. On easier difficulties, it's just a good story. The story is engaging and worth playing, especially if you can get both 2033 and Last Light on sale. Play 2033 first. Last Light is a prequel.

I am somewhere in the middle of the game I guess, Sparta guys just saved me and we are driving that crappy turret.

This game has a lot of good things and a lot of bad things.
Good - Visuals, level design, weapons are pretty okay.
Bad - Story. There is still advanced civilization after nuking? Really? Maintenance alone would cripple those tunnels in a month, then weapons and train parts too. 
Monsters are like HP sponges, even with close range shotgun it takes 3 shots on average at close range to kill them.
Some tasks are extremely unexplained in very russian way. Like where you have to bomb tunnels under unending spawning monsters and you have to run around map searching what to do next. First time I ran out of bullets defending corner for 20 minutes.
Flying monsters seem invulnerable and boring. Those strange tunnel lights were also strange and the dude who spouts pseudoreligion... urgh.
Yea, stealth is pretty awful too. Knives you get are overpowered as hell and melee "kill" has many limitations.
Also when combat start enemy generally knows where you are and is very precise with shooting, so direct combat is mostly awful too.

I will finish the game probably, but it kinda fails in many ways. 6/10.

I played Metro 2033 for the first time in April 2022 - so graphically, the game was not "new". But it is a really good experience, it develops a lot of atmosphere and set aside facial animations, which are pretty outdated and probably were when the game released in 2010, it still looks nice.
Both soundtrack and voice acting in English get the job done. Voice acting especially is really well done. I disliked the sound effects on some guns, though. They lack a certain "punch".
Speaking of things I dislike: having played Exodus before this, it's lack of "space" is jarring. The levels are big, don't get me wrong, but it's sooo damn linear.
The story is okay, I guess. Nothing to write home about - but it's easily forgotten when you are in combat: the game feels dark, gritty and really sells the post-apocaypse.
8/10

For me the Metro Series as a whole, has been one of my most favorite games up there with Half Life, and Dishonored.

Metro 2033 and other entries in the series have great gameplay and an very immersive worlds, I've put hundreds of hours into the series and see myself coming back for more playthroughs every year. If its your first playthrough, I wouldn't recommend Ranger Hardcore for it, unless you're confident in your ablilties.

Though there are some bugs in the first two games, random crashes at times; It's not unplayable however, but they happen not often as for in a single playthrough you're unlikely to run into these issues. 
On Ranger Hardcore, there is a UI bug that doesn't show your throwables when you switch them with tab, with only an audio cue that will tell you which you have selected; However this is manageable if you've familiarized yourself with them on previous sittings. On Exodus this has been majorly fixed and it doesn't have this problem.
In Last Light, there is a bug where in after/during the level Bandits you loose all ability to do take downs, which heavily makes trying to get the good ending of the game difficult in later levels. 

If you're a fan of 2033 and Last light and haven't given Exodus a try because of the drift to Open World; I highly recommend you give it a try, as it doesn't feel out of place. Exodus has become one of my favorite games in the series.
With the added crafting mechanic, expanded weapon systems, and various other elements. It has a great story and the DLC's for it are great, my favorite out of the two being Sam's Story.
I have yet to give Ironmode(NG+) mode a try yet, as I don't have my old saves, but I'll update my opinion on that when I get a chance.

Overall, if you're a returning fan, a fan of games like Dishonored, Half Life, Stalker, and other FPS's, or hesitant; I highly recommend this game series to you, it's truly one of my favorite series out there. So next time you its on sale, I recommend you pick up the series!

Seriously, out of almost 200 games in my library, this is by far the worst piece of garbage. Let me explain:

Just 5 minutes ago i gave up on my FOURTH (!) and definitely final attempt at actually finishing this game. Every single attempt over the past years I started the game from scratch on a fresh install. Yet every single time I get about halfway through the story, some random crash deletes ALL my collectibles, ALL the control settings, and basically disables my keyboard and mouse, so once I continue playing I can't even hit ESC to get to the menu.

I tried it on two completely different PCs with different specs and on different Windows installations (7, 8, 10). Same result, the game becomes unplayable.

I can deal with random crashes, it happens in a lot of games.
I can deal with starting over ONCE. 

However, I can not deal with the game erasing all my progress and basically locking me out of the gameplay, repeatedly. Calling this "rebuilt and remastered for next-gen" is nothing but a joke.

To end this review on a good note, the story is quite good. Would have loved to finish it. (I tried)

Brilliant Game, A Classic Reduxed with better Graphics and improved mechanics. 
10/10 Must Own.

EDIT 2022: 
The two Redux's are plagued with crashing issues on modern GPUs - the developers have never addressed this issue, or acknowledged it and their are no fixes to these issues. 
If you are having constant crashing problems with the game - theres absolutely no way to fix it, thats something you should consider when you decide to get the game. 

Metro is my favourite series, but - this is just something that can't be ignored. After upgrading to a 1660ti. I am ultimately unable to get past loading screens.

Unfortunately I cannot recommend this game. Not sure where all the positive reviews are coming from but "Survival Horror" doesn't really seem to apply unless you play the absolute hardest difficulty. The game is very easy. I made sure I picked the regular option and not the easy way through the game. There are some unintuitive moments in this game which really break the immersion. I got stuck for a while with a character named Khan until I burnt some spider webs in font of him with a lighter the game NEVER told me I had. The animations of the monsters in this game are hilarious and totally not scary in anyway, shape, or form. I got the series on sale for a couple bucks so I am not really upset but I hope the later games deliver. The first one is not scary, super on rails and you have a companion of some form with you for hours. Half-Life 2 is scarier and more challenging and better than this game. I'd also recommend the STALKER series over this. Similar "vibe" but much better in execution as far as their first entries in the series go. Kinda disappointing but maybe Last Light and Exodus are better. The lighting, combat and animations are a real let down for a survival horror game. It is all way to easy.

Is Potato.

But seriously, it's not an entirely inaccurate descriptive. The game's not bad, but it could have been much better. You gotta add some extra ingredients to make the weapons decent, but even with garnish they're still not all that interesting. Plus the MC himself is about as agile as a potato. The setting seems like a great start but never gets all that interesting no matter how deep you dig into it. And there were little birsts of flavor here and there with the story, but that too ends up highly under-cooked and under-seasoned. In the end, you just find more potato. 

In terms of playtime, it was definitely less than the 10 hrs. I clocked. I had it up while afk for awhile - probably 1-2 hrs. And again, it's definitely not bad, it's just not as good as it could have been on any front, either. My biggest issue is that it seems like there's a deeper, more interesting story but you never really learn anything about it. My guess would be the other games in the series get more interesting. If so, just skip this one - you won't miss any important developments.
